intro: Minythodes, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Minythodes is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
